title: 26-Mile 2022 Ford GT
description: This 2022 Ford GT was ordered by the seller and delivered new to Pat Milliken Ford in Redford Township, Michigan. It has 26 miles and is finished in Frozen White with over-the-top Lightning Blue stripes over a black Alcantara Dark Energy interior. Equipment includes an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, Satin Silver 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, and a retractable active rear wing. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This Ford GT is now offered with the ordering kit, a window sticker, photos of the car during production, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 26-Mile 2022 Ford GT at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #192,188.
text: This 2022 Ford GT was ordered by the seller and delivered new to Pat Milliken Ford in Redford Township, Michigan. It has 26 miles and is finished in Frozen White with over-the-top Lightning Blue stripes over a black Alcantara Dark Energy interior. Equipment includes an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, Satin Silver 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, and a retractable active rear wing. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This Ford GT is now offered with the ordering kit, a window sticker, photos of the car during production, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name. The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished Frozen White with over-the-top Lightning Blue stripes. Additional features include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, a front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features. Staggered-width 20″ forged aluminum wheels finished in Satin Silver are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Braking is handled by red-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back. The cabin was optioned with the Dark Energy package and features black Alcantara over the Sparco seats with manually reclining carbon-fiber shells. Exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door panels, and the fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column. Additional equipment includes automatic climate control and a touchscreen infotainment system. The Alcantara-wrapped multi-function steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 26 miles. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and was factory rated at 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. An Akrapovič titanium exhaust system is fitted along with carbon-fiber aero panels fore and aft. The window sticker notes initial delivery to Pat Milliken Ford in Redford Township, Michigan, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total MSRP of $555,350. An ordering kit is also included with the car along with a battery tender and photos of the car during production. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. html:
This 2022 Ford GT was ordered by the seller and delivered new to Pat Milliken Ford in Redford Township, Michigan. It has 26 miles and is finished in Frozen White with over-the-top Lightning Blue stripes over a black Alcantara Dark Energy interior. Equipment includes an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, Satin Silver 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, and a retractable active rear wing. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This Ford GT is now offered with the ordering kit, a window sticker, photos of the car during production, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished Frozen White with over-the-top Lightning Blue stripes. Additional features include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim.

The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, a front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features.

Staggered-width 20″ forged aluminum wheels finished in Satin Silver are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Braking is handled by red-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back.

The cabin was optioned with the Dark Energy package and features black Alcantara over the Sparco seats with manually reclining carbon-fiber shells. Exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door panels, and the fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column. Additional equipment includes automatic climate control and a touchscreen infotainment system.

The Alcantara-wrapped multi-function steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 26 miles.

The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and was factory rated at 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. An Akrapovič titanium exhaust system is fitted along with carbon-fiber aero panels fore and aft.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to Pat Milliken Ford in Redford Township, Michigan, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total MSRP of $555,350.

An ordering kit is also included with the car along with a battery tender and photos of the car during production.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
